Events that occurred on 13 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1943 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49d.
1951 - Final day of the Congrès Internationale de Philologie Moderne at the University of Liège, a conference in which J.R.R. Tolkien delivers the paper "Middle English 'Losenger'".
1951 - Actor Bruce Phillips is born.
1974 - The first Oxonmoot is held at The Welsh Poney, Oxford.
1992 - The second part of the 1992 radio series of The Adventures of Tom Bombadil is aired on BBC Radio 5.
1996 - Actor Sadwyn Brophy is born.
2002 - Oxonmoot 2002 at St Antony's College.
2014 - Oxonmoot 2014 at Lady Margaret Hall.
2015 - Oxonmoot 2015 at St Antony's College.
2019 - Oxonmoot 2019 at St Antony's College.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
Celeborn and Galadriel depart for Lothlórien by way of the Redhorn Pass; the rest of the escort set out for Rivendell.[1]

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
